verses.text: And when the queen of Sheba heard of the fame of Solomon , she came to prove Solomon with hard questions at Jerusalem , with a very great company , and camels that bare spices , and gold in abundance , and precious stones : and when she was come to Solomon , she communed with him of all that was in her heart.
And Solomon told her all her questions : and there was nothing hid from Solomon which he told her not.
And when the queen of Sheba had seen the wisdom of Solomon , and the house that he had built ,

And the meat of his table , and the sitting of his servants , and the attendance of his ministers , and their apparel ; his cupbearers also, and their apparel ; and his ascent by which he went up into the house of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*; there was no more spirit in her.\f + \fr 9.4 \ft cupbearers: or, butlers\f*
And she said to the king , \add It was\add* a true report which I heard in mine own land of thine acts , and of thy wisdom :\f + \fr 9.5 \ft report: Heb. word\f*\f + \fr 9.5 \ft acts: or, sayings\f*

Howbeit I believed not their words , until I came , and mine eyes had seen \add it:\add* and, behold, the one half of the greatness of thy wisdom was not told me: \add for\add* thou exceedest the fame that I heard.
Happy \add are\add* thy men , and happy \add are\add* these thy servants , which stand continually before thee, and hear thy wisdom.

Blessed be the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* thy God , which delighted in thee to set thee on his throne , \add to be\add* king for the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* thy God : because thy God loved Israel , to establish them for ever , therefore made he thee king over them, to do judgment and justice.
And she gave the king an hundred and twenty talents of gold , and of spices great abundance , and precious stones : neither was there any such spice as the queen of Sheba gave king Solomon.
And the servants also of Huram , and the servants of Solomon , which brought gold from Ophir , brought algum trees and precious stones.\f + \fr 9.10 \ft algum…: also called, almug trees\f*

And the king made \add of\add* the algum trees terraces to the house of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and to the king’s palace , and harps and psalteries for singers : and there were none such seen before in the land of Judah.\f + \fr 9.11 \ft terraces: or, stairs: Heb. highways\f*

And king Solomon gave to the queen of Sheba all her desire , whatsoever she asked , beside \add that\add* which she had brought unto the king. So she turned , and went away to her own land , she and her servants. \p
¶ Now the weight of gold that came to Solomon in one year was six hundred and threescore and six talents of gold ;
Beside \add that which\add* chapmen and merchants brought. And all the kings of Arabia and governors of the country brought gold and silver to Solomon.\f + \fr 9.14 \ft governors: or, captains\f* \p
¶ And king Solomon made two hundred targets \add of\add* beaten gold : six hundred \add shekels\add* of beaten gold went to one target.
And three hundred shields \add made he of\add* beaten gold : three hundred \add shekels\add* of gold went to one shield. And the king put them in the house of the forest of Lebanon.
Moreover the king made a great throne of ivory , and overlaid it with pure gold.

And \add there were\add* six steps to the throne , with a footstool of gold , \add which were\add* fastened to the throne , and stays on each side of the sitting place , and two lions standing by the stays :\f + \fr 9.18 \ft stays: Heb. hands\f*
And twelve lions stood there on the one side and on the other upon the six steps. There was not the like made in any kingdom. \p

¶ And all the drinking vessels of king Solomon \add were of\add* gold , and all the vessels of the house of the forest of Lebanon \add were of\add* pure gold : none \add were of\add* silver ; it was \add not\add* any thing accounted of in the days of Solomon.\f + \fr 9.20 \ft pure: Heb. shut up\f*\f + \fr 9.20 \ft none were of silver: or, there was no silver in them\f*

For the king’s ships went to Tarshish with the servants of Huram : every three years once came the ships of Tarshish bringing gold , and silver , ivory , and apes , and peacocks.\f + \fr 9.21 \ft ivory: or, elephants’ teeth\f*
And king Solomon passed all the kings of the earth in riches and wisdom. \p
¶ And all the kings of the earth sought the presence of Solomon , to hear his wisdom , that God had put in his heart.
And they brought every man his present , vessels of silver , and vessels of gold , and raiment , harness , and spices , horses , and mules , a rate year by year. \p
¶ And Solomon had four thousand stalls for horses and chariots , and twelve thousand horsemen ; whom he bestowed in the chariot cities , and with the king at Jerusalem. \p
¶ And he reigned over all the kings from the river even unto the land of the Philistines , and to the border of Egypt.\f + \fr 9.26 \ft river: that is, Euphrates\f*
And the king made silver in Jerusalem as stones , and cedar trees made he as the sycomore trees that \add are\add* in the low plains in abundance.\f + \fr 9.27 \ft made silver: Heb. gave silver\f*
And they brought unto Solomon horses out of Egypt , and out of all lands. \p

¶ Now the rest of the acts of Solomon , first and last , \add are\add* they not written in the book of Nathan the prophet , and in the prophecy of Ahijah the Shilonite , and in the visions of Iddo the seer against Jeroboam the son of Nebat ?\f + \fr 9.29 \ft book: Heb. words\f*
And Solomon reigned in Jerusalem over all Israel forty years.
And Solomon slept with his fathers , and he was buried in the city of David his father : and Rehoboam his son reigned in his stead.
